DOC.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Treating Children With Progressive Low-Grade Astrocytoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine tumor growth rate decrease target area increase choline activity , measure magnetic resonance spectroscopic imaging , pediatric patient progressive low grade astrocytoma treat surgical resection and/or focal radiotherapy . II . Improve quality life without use aggressive surgery radiotherapy patient population . OUTLINE : Patients undergo magnetic resonance spectroscopic imaging ( MRSI ) 60 minute prior surgery and/or radiotherapy . Patients assign one two treatment arm base tumor accessibility may crossover either arm . Arm I : Patients undergo conventional surgery . Arm II : Patients inaccessible tumor undergo focal radiotherapy . Following surgery and/or radiotherapy , patient follow every 4 month 2 year MRSI MRI tumor response growth . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 24 patient accrue study 2 year .
